Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi,
`Do you guys think this incentivized test will be worth while?`
good ideas posted.  Here's my .02:
- stress test not worth 5k KMD. Could be done for free.
- attracting and keeping new people/projects worth a chunk of budget
- use test to promote launch (big test then small launch good?)
- bug hunt, hack-a-thon great ideas! more smaller events rather than one 5k shot?
- `"spam king" "points for style" "blackest hat" "top hype man" "the conductor"` attracts more active participation and unanticipated results. very cool.
- `And scripts can be checked on some "judge" machince`  how about test Labs bounty scheme?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: It'd be nice to test the judge machine.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: tbh, my opinions are just gonna make paying bounties harder lol. I think a hybrid vote + judge macgine component is a good mix

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: also in terms or getting fresh blood in, rather than tweetspam a targeted approach to builder communities hits our target market. The'res a few blockchain courses people are learning at etc, and communities like https://www.hackster.io/ which would be worth poaching talent from through focussed hype and incentivisation to participate.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: offering tokens for retweeting wont lead to innovation and many will just disappear once paid.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Yeah, that kind of promotion is annoying :)

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: maybe prizes for doing well with participation can be tied to helping winners build something?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I think it's good to keep it simple if we will do an incentivized test. BEER/PIZZA tests are a big reason Joker and I got so involved. For many of you, it was the pos64 tests. Both sets of tests had strong results and were dead simple
